Content:
Declaration of Origin
The Declaration of Origin (Form DA 59) must accompany goods exported to South Africa subject to anti-dumping, countervailing, safeguard duties, or import restrictions against specific countries—shipments stop until provided. One original signed copy needed; no Chamber of Commerce or Customs stamp required.
MSDS-NON DG
Goods under IATA Special Provisions A67 require an MSDS. Advisable for UAE transits to avoid delays—include in shipment and upload to IDIS.
Info About Section Header: This section explains the paperwork needed when bringing goods into South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *DA 59 Form*: Needed for goods with special duties or restrictions—provide 1 signed original or shipment stops.
- *MSDS*: Batteries (IATA A67) need an MSDS—add it for UAE transits to avoid delays.

Content:
Post Office Boxes
UPS requires full street address and consignee phone—no P.O. Boxes.
Duty and Taxes
Include freight and fees in value for duties/taxes.
Registration Number
Importers/exporters need a SARS-registered code; private individuals need SA ID or SARS Tax Reference Number—delays if missing.
Payment by Credit Card
Accepted on delivery—check with UPS South Africa for card types.
Customs Clearance Process
SARS revenue drive causes delays. Declare accurate export value—undervaluing risks R2500 penalty + 10% VAT if not cleared in 14 days. Clearance involves document checks, possible inspections, and duty/VAT collection—allow 7-28 days.
Info About Section Header: This section provides details on customs processes in South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *No P.O. Boxes*: Use full address with phone.
- *Duty & Tax*: Add shipping fees to item value.
- *Registration*: Provide SARS importer/exporter code or SA ID—delays without it.
- *Pay by Card*: Credit cards okay on delivery—confirm with UPS SA.
- *Clearance*: Expect delays; declare true value or face R2500 fine + 10% VAT. Clear in 7 days (14 for bulk, 28 for containers).

Content:
Service to certain cities.
UPS requires full street address and consignee phone—no P.O. Boxes.
Rest Days: Saturday, Sunday, holidays.
GMT: +0200
Language: English
Currency: Rand (ZAR)
Info About Section Header: This section lists shipping locations in South Africa, time zones, and holidays.
Simplified Form: - *Coverage*: Serves select cities.
- *Address*: Full street details and phone—no P.O. Boxes.
- *Rest Days*: Off Saturday, Sunday, SA holidays.
- *Time Zone*: GMT +0200 year-round.
- *Language & Money*: English; pay in Rand (ZAR).

Content:
Duties and Taxes
Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—third-party details needed. Surcharge if billed outside South Africa.
Shipping Charges
Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—account number required.
Payment Methods
Only shipper can pay by card, check, or cash.
Third-Party Billing
Domestic shipments can’t bill third parties outside SA unless payor has a VAT/Tax ID.
Info About Section Header: This section explains payment options for shipping costs in South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Who Pays*: Duties/taxes to shipper, receiver, or third party—add third-party name and account.
- *Extra Fee*: Billing outside SA adds a surcharge.
- *Shipping Costs*: Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—needs account number.
- *Payment*: Only shipper can use card, check, or cash.
- *Third-Party Rule*: SA-to-SA can’t bill outside unless payor has a VAT ID.

Content:
Cosmetics/Coffee/Tea
May need Dept of Health review.
Machinery/Electronics
May need NRCS Letter of Authority—importer must confirm.
Miscellaneous
Petroleum, raw/scrap metal need import permits.
Intercompany Data
CDs/USB sticks need invoice with data and item value.
Unsolicited Gifts
Max 2 per year, ≤R1400 each—duty rebated.
Medicine/Drugs
Needs MCC registration and import license; unregistered needs Section 21 permit—entry via JNB, CPT, PE, DUR only.
Animal Products
Feeds may need Health, Agriculture, or State Vet review.
Samples
Max 6 items, marked/mutilated, with customs value.
Textiles
From China need DA59 Certificate of Origin.
Info About Section Header: This section lists special rules for shipping certain goods to South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Cosmetics/Coffee/Tea*: Dept of Health may check.
- *Machinery/Electronics*: NRCS Letter may be needed—importer to verify.
- *Special Items*: Petroleum, scrap metal need permits.
- *Data*: CDs/USBs need invoice with data and item value.
- *Gifts*: 2/year, ≤R1400—duty-free if unsolicited.
- *Medicine*: MCC license or Section 21 permit—use JNB, CPT, PE, DUR.
- *Animal Feeds*: Health, Agri, or Vet may review.
- *Samples*: Max 6, marked, with value.
- *Textiles*: China-made need DA59.

Content:
Shipment value: 1400 ZAR
Type: Individual-to-individual
Rule: Per shipment, max 2/year
Mark 'gift shipment' on invoice and waybill.
Info About Section Header: This section explains gift tax exemptions in South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Gift Limit*: ≤R1400, 2 per year, person-to-person—duty-free.
- *Label It*: Write 'gift shipment' on invoice and waybill.

Content:
Paperless Invoice
Accepted for imports, available for exports.
Invoice
Non-documents need 1 original + 2 copies in English, with value in foreign currency (ZAR only with FEC number), air waybill number, consignee phone, email—no proforma.
Info About Section Header: This section details invoice requirements for shipping to South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Paperless*: Okay for imports, available for exports.
- *Invoice*: 1 original + 2 copies, English, foreign currency (ZAR with FEC), waybill number, phone, email—no proforma.

Content: Bids, checks, intercompany mail (non-commercial, zero value), event tickets, etc., count as documents.
Info About Section Header: This section lists items treated as documents for shipping to South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Documents*: Bids, tickets, zero-value intercompany mail—no invoice needed.
- *Mark It*: Describe intercompany mail on waybill, check 'Documents Only'.

Content:
Prohibited: Personal effects, lithium metal batteries via Emirates, passports (except embassy-to-embassy).
Restricted: Alcohol (ISC only, permits needed).
Info About Section Header: This section lists items banned or restricted in South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Banned*: No personal effects, lithium metal batteries (via Dubai), passports (unless embassy).
- *Alcohol*: ISC only—needs exemption cert (non-commercial) or liquor license (commercial).

Content:
India to South Africa
UPS Worldwide Express Saver, Expedited, Express Freight, Express, Express Plus
Info About Section Header: This section lists shipping services from India to South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *India to SA*: Pick Express Saver, Expedited, Express Freight, Express, or Express Plus—check UPS.

Content:
Warranty Shipments
Returns: Invoice shows purchase price, repair cost (zero if under warranty), needs warranty cert. Replacements: Full duty/VAT on market value.
Solid Wood Packing Material
ISPM 15 applies—needs phytosanitary cert for raw wood >6mm.
Private Shipments
Max 3/year, ≤R50,000—needs SA ID, ITAC permit for used items.
Repair and Return
Entry: Duty/VAT deposit, refunded on export. Return: Needs export docs, DA65 for rebate.
Info About Section Header: This section covers rules for special shipments to South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Warranty Returns*: List price, repair cost (zero if warranted), add cert—duty on repair only.
- *Warranty Replacements*: Full duty/VAT on market value.
- *Wood Packing*: Raw wood >6mm needs ISPM 15 cert.
- *Private*: 3/year, ≤R50,000—needs ID, ITAC for used items.
- *Repair & Return*: Entry: pay deposit, refunded on export. Return: export docs + DA65 for rebate.

Content:
Deminimis: 500 ZAR—duty/tax-free below this.
Exports >$1,000 USD need formal clearance from India.
Info About Section Header: This section states value thresholds for taxes/duties in South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Low Value*: ≤R500—duty/tax-free.
- *High Exports*: >$1,000 USD from India needs formal clearance.

Content:
Max weight: 70 kg (150 lbs.)
Max length: 274 cm (107.9 in.)
Max dimensions: 400 cm (157.5 in.) length + girth
Info About Section Header: This section specifies max weight and size for packages to South Africa.
Simplified Form: - *Weight Limit*: 70 kg (150 lbs.) max.
- *Size Limits*: Max length 274 cm (107.9 in.), length + girth 400 cm (157.5 in.).
